articles.author: LISA MASCARO and KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump abruptly rejected a bipartisan plan Wednesday to prevent a Christmastime government shutdown, instead telling House Speaker Mike Johnson and Republicans to essentially renegotiate — days before a deadline when federal funding runs out.
articles.title: Government funding plan collapses as Trump makes new demands days before shutdown

articles.author: STAN CHOE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — U.S. stocks tumbled to one of their worst days of the year after the Federal Reserve hinted Wednesday it may deliver fewer shots of adrenaline for the U.S.
articles.title: US stocks fall sharply and Dow tumbles 1,100 points after the Fed hints at just 2 rate cuts for 2025

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER RUGABER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Federal Reserve cut its key interest rate Wednesday by a quarter-point — its third cut this year — but also signaled that it expects to reduce rates more slowly next year than it previously envisioned, mostly because of still-elevated inflation.
articles.title: Federal Reserve cuts its key rate by a quarter-point but envisions fewer reductions next year

articles.author: JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — New York prosecutors are using a 9/11-era anti-terrorism law in their case against the man charged with gunning down UnitedHealthcare's CEO outside a midtown Manhattan hotel.
articles.title: How New York prosecutors used a terrorism law in the charges against Luigi Mangione

articles.author: MICHAEL KUNZELMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The federal judge who presided over the seditious conspiracy case against Oath Keepers members said Wednesday that it would be "frightening" if the anti-government group's founder, Stewart Rhodes, is pardoned for orchestrating a violent plot to keep Donald Trump in the White House after he lost the 2020 presidential election.
articles.title: Judge: Pardoning Oath Keepers leader Stewart Rhodes for Capitol riot plot would be 'frightening'

articles.author: FARNOUSH AMIRI and LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The House Ethics Committee voted in secret to release the long-awaited ethics report into ex-Rep. Matt Gaetz, raising the possibility that the allegations against the Florida Republican who was President-elect Donald Trump's first choice for attorney general could be made public in the coming days.
articles.title: House Ethics Committee secretly voted to release Matt Gaetz ethics report, source says

articles.author: TOM KRISHER
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — U.S. auto safety regulators have backed away from seeking a giant recall of nearly 50 million air bag inflators and will investigate further after the auto industry raised questions about whether all of the inflators are defective.
articles.title: US retreats from massive air bag recall and says industry comments show need for more investigation

articles.author: SAM MEDNICK, ADRIENNE SURPRENANT and SYLVIE CORBET
articles.description: MAMOUDZOU, Mayotte (AP) — They clustered around water taps, rare sources of electricity and each other. Four days after the strongest cyclone in nearly a century ripped through the French island territory of Mayotte off the coast of Africa, survivors recalled the horror of the storm that caught many by surprise.
articles.title: Survivors recount 'very apocalyptic' cyclone that ripped through French territory of Mayotte

articles.author: TODD RICHMOND, SCOTT BAUER and RYAN J. FOLEY
articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — Wisconsin police did not plan any public updates Wednesday on the extremely rare religious school shooting that killed a teacher and a student and wounded six others, a day after the city’s mayor chastised reporters and urged them to leave victims alone.
articles.title: Wisconsin police go quiet on school shooting as search for answers continues

articles.author: AMY BETH HANSON
articles.description: HELENA, Mont. (AP) — Montana’s Supreme Court on Wednesday upheld a landmark climate ruling that said the state was violating residents’ constitutional right to a clean environment by permitting oil, gas and coal projects without regard for global warming.
articles.title: Global warming can't be ignored, Montana's top court says, upholding landmark climate case
